page.title: 02The Mere At Alsager
page.content: The Mere is a main attraction in Alsager. It was formed by a natural spring, and developed from marshland to a beautiful sight and attraction. In the early 19th century there was only one building around the Mere, this was an Inn. About 50 years ago the Mere was drained so it was possible to build houses. Now the Mere is surrounded with large houses with 2 small areas for public access-gardens. There have not been any problems of subsidence, so the drainage must be effective. The only problem is that the people in the public gardens often make a noise late at night. There are approximately 40 houses around the Mere in a variety of sizes. The problem of the public gardens only affects a few of these houses around the Mere. The Mere is used by the residents for boating and swimming.
